title: Retrospective Examination of Q Fever Endocarditis: An Underdiagnosed Disease in the Mainland of China
patient: A 58-year-old man admitted in March 2014 due to recurring fever lasting over four years. In 2010 he underwent anti-tuberculosis treatment. Over the next few years, vegetations were found, and he was placed on various antibiotics. He underwent aortic and mitral valvuloplasty, however, 8 months after the operation his recurring fever continued, and perivalvular leaks was found.
